Description: PURPOSE:TETON COUNTY APPLIES FOR $25.0 MILLION IN FFY 2020 BUILD FUNDS TO IMPLEMENT THE TETON MOBILITY CORRIDOR IMPROVEMENTS (TMCI) PROGRAM. THIS MULTIMODAL PROGRAM WILL IMPLEMENT A SERIES OF TRANSIT BICYCLE/PEDESTRIAN AND ROADWAY SAFETY INVESTMENTS TO IMPROVE TRAVEL AND SAFETY ALONG THE ID-33/WY-22 CORRIDOR BETWEEN DRIGGS IDAHO AND JACKSON WYOMING. THIS CORRIDOR IS VITAL FOR CONNECTING RESIDENTS AND VISITORS IN THE AREA TO THE REGIONS ECONOMIC GENERATORS INCLUDING THE GRAND TARGHEE RESORT CITY OF DRIGGS CITY OF VICTOR JACKSON HOLE MOUNTAIN RESORT AND THE TOWN OF JACKSON ALL LOCATED WITHIN TETON COUNTY WYOMING AND TETON COUNTY IDAHO. THE ACCOMPANYING PAPER GRANT AGREEMENT AND DISCRETIONARY APPLICATION RELATED MATERIALS ARE ATTACHED IN TRAMS. THE FUNDS ARE LAPSING AND ARE PROVIDED AT AN OVERALL 57% FEDERAL MATCHING RATIO. THE RECIPIENT COMMITS TO DISBURSING ALL FUNDS BY THE SEPTEMBER 30 2027 DEADLINE. (THE DISCRETIONARY ID NUMBER IS #D2022-RPAU-014.)ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:SPECIFIC COMPONENTS TO BE FUNDED WITHIN THE OVERALL TMCI PROGRAM INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: - CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW TRANSIT CENTER AND UPGRADES TO TWO EXISTING PARK RIDES (COMPONENTS #1 #8 AND #9) - ACQUISITION OF TRANSIT SIGNAL PRIORITY COMPONENTS TO IMPLEMENT AN UPGRADED COMMUNICATION SYSTEM BETWEEN BUSES AND TRAFFIC SIGNALS (COMPONENT #2)- PURCHASE OF SIX EXPANSION BUSES FOR THE START TRANSIT FLEET INCLUDING TWO ELECTRIC BUSES AND FOUR COMMUTER BUSES (COMPONENTS #3 AND #4) - CONSTRUCTION OF SEVERAL MULTIUSE PATHWAYS AND IMPLEMENTATION OF ASSOCIATED MULTIMODAL SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS (COMPONENTS #5 #6 #7 #10 AND #11)- IMPLEMENTATION OF MULTIMODAL SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS ALONG HIGHWAY ID-33 (COMPONENTS #12 AND #13) EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE COMPONENTS OF THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE TRAVELING AND PUBLIC TRANSIT CONDITIONS IN THE TETON AREA IN WYOMING AND IDAHO.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE TRAVELING PUBLIC AND TRANSIT PATRONS OF TETON COUNTY AND ASSOCIATED TRAVEL REGION WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS BUILD PROJECT.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:SUBRECIPIENTS TO THIS AGREEMENT INCLUDE: THE TOWN OF JACKSON WY/THE SOUTHERN TETON AREA RAPID TRANSIT (START); THE CITY OF DRIGGS ID; TETON COUNTY IDAHO; AND THE IDAHO TRANSPORTATION DEPARTMENT (ITD).OTHER:THE COMPONENTS OF THIS PROJECT HAVE BEEN CLEARED ENVIRONMENTALLY AS CATEGORICAL EXCLUSIONS. RELATED DOCUMENTATION IS ATTACHED TO EACH PROJECT. THE PROJECT IS ALSO INCLUDED IN THE WYOMING STIP WITH APPROPRIATE DOCUMENTATION ALSO ATTACHED.A DETAILED PROJECT BUDGET IS ATTACHED AND INCLUDES LOCAL FUNDS PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL COMMUNITIES FROM THEIR RESPECTIVE GENERAL FUNDS AND CONSTRUCTION RESERVE ACCOUNTS.NO PRE-AWARD IS AUTHORIZED FOR THIS BUILD APPLICATION.(FEDERAL PLANNING FUNDS ARE ALSO BEING CONTRIBUTED TO THE PROJECT UNDER WYDOTS AWARD #WY-2022-002 TO ASSIST IN FUNDING DESIGN.)

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE ONEIDA NATION WILL CONSTRUCT A NEW TRANSIT GARAGE THAT CONSISTS OF OFFICE SPACE VEHICLE STORAGE WASH BAY AND MEZZANINES TO ACCOMMODATE THE TRANSIT DEPARTMENT.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: CONSTRUCTION OF A TRANSIT GARAGE.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IMPROVE EFFICIENCY REDUCE MAINTENANCE COSTS SAFETY AND SECURITY FOR OUR VEHICLES AND IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE. THIS GARAGE WILL ALSO HELP PREVENT FAILURE OF SOME MECHANICAL ELEMENTS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE EMPLOYEES OF ONEIDA PUBLIC TRANSIT THE ONEIDA COMMUNITY AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM A WELL-MAINTAINED VEHICLE STORAGE FACILITY.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

PURPOSETHIS GRANT WILL UTILIZE $5817640 IN FY20 BUILD GRANT FUNDS TO UNDERTAKE THE RED CLIFF BAND OF LAKE SUPERIOR CHIPPEWA TRANSPORTATION RENEWAL PROJECT. THIS GRANT IS FUNDED AT 100% FEDERAL SHARE. THE PROJECT WILL CREATE JOBS (BOTH SHORT-TERM CONSTRUCTION RELATED JOBS AND LONG-TERM FULL TIME EQUIVALENT (FTE) POSITIONS) AND FACILITATE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT BY ADDING CAPACITY TO MEET THE TRANSPORTATION NEED; EXPANDING TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS; IMPROVING/MAINTAINING ROADWAYS FOR USERS; CENTRALIZING TRANSPORTATION OPERATIONS SERVICES AND DEPARTMENTS; AND IMPROVING THE OVERALL QUALITY OF LIFE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDTHE PROJECT WILL DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT A NEW APPROX. 22000 SQ.FT. TRANSPORTATION CENTER ON A TRIBAL-OWNED UNIMPROVED PARCEL OFF STATE HIGHWAY 13 REPLACE AGING ROADWAY EQUIPMENT AND ADD BUSES TO MISKWAABEKONG TRANSIT SERVICE (FUNDED SEPARATELY). THE TRANSPORTATION CENTER WILL SERVE AS A MULTI-USE FACILITY FOR THE MISKWAABEKONG TRANSIT SERVICE. IT WILL BE THE MAIN ADMINISTRATIVE CENTER; BUS AND EQUIPMENT MAINTENANCE SHOP; AND GARAGE. THE MULTI-PURPOSE FACILITY WILL INCLUDE STORAGE AND MAINTENANCE BAYS ELECTRIC VEHICLE CHARGING STATIONS A WORKSHOP A TRAINING CENTER FOR TRANSPORTATION WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT (IN COOPERATION WITH WEDC AND SOFTEC EDUCATION) AND TRANSPORTATION-RELATED OFFICE SPACE. THE SITE DEVELOPMENT WILL INCLUDE PAVED ACCESS DRIVEWAY AND PARKING SELECTIVE LOT CLEARING UNDERGROUND UTILITIES CONNECTION A WELL WATER SYSTEM TWO STORMWATER RETENTION AND TREATMENT BASINS ONSITE WASTEWATER TREATMENT SYSTEM PERIMETER FENCING AND SIGNAGE. TRANSPORTATION EQUIPMENT TO BE ACQUIRED INCLUDES: TWO (2) 80000 GVW COMBINED PLOW TRUCKS WITH SNOW EQUIPMENT ONE (1) 54000 LBS EXCAVATOR ONE (1) 181 HP MOTOR GRADER ONE (1) GRADER SNOW WING AND PLOW ONE (1) 230 HP WHEEL LOADER ONE (1) LOADER SNOW WING AND PLOWEXPECTED OUTCOMESINCREASED PUBLIC ACCESS TO ROADWAYS IMPROVED RESPONSE TIME FOR SNOW PLOWING AND ROADWAY MAINTENANCE NEEDSIMPROVED TRANSIT SYSTEM LEVEL OF SERVICE AND INCREASED PASSENGER COUNTS DUE TO BETTER ACCESS VEHICLE CONDITION AND ROADWAY CONDITIONSINCREASED ROADWAY CONDITION RATINGS DUE TO INCREASED MAINTENANCE CAPACITYINCREASED TRANSIT ACCESS TO EMPLOYMENT EDUCATION HEALTH CARE SHOPPING AND RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOSTERED COORDINATION WITH TRANSPORTATION RELATED EFFORTS BY CENTRALIZING TRANSPORTATION RELATED OFFICESINTENDED BENEFICIARIESGENERAL PUBLIC STAKEHOLDERS INCL. NATIONAL PARK SERVICE RESIDENTS (TRIBAL /NON-TRIBAL) TOURISTS LANDOWNERS COMMERCIAL DEVELOPERS UTILITY COMPANIES GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES (TOWN COUNTY STATE AND FEDERAL) AND TRIBAL BUSINESSES SUBRECIPEINT ACTIVITIESNONEATTACHMENTS TO THIS APPLICATION INCLUDE THE FY20 BUILD TERMS AND CONDITIONS SIGNED BUILD PAPER GRANT AGREEMENT DATED 4/14/22 AND NEPA ENVIRONMENTAL DOCUMENTS AND APPROVAL SIGNED 10/20/21 .

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE GRANT WILL FUND A TRANSIT CORRIDOR STUDY THAT WILL HELP IMPROVE TRANSIT ACCESS TO THE DEVELOPING ECONOMIC AREAS KNOWN AS THE GRANARY DISTRICT AND THE DEPOT DISTRICT AND TIE THESE DISTRICTS TO THE UNIVERSITY OF UTAH RESEARCH PARK.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS APPLICATION WILL BUILD UPON PRIOR PLANNING EFFORTS TO IDENTIFY A NEW TRANSIT CORRIDOR. IT WILL ALSO ESTABLISH A NEW MODEL FOR THE SALT LAKE CITY AREA FOR INTERAGENCY COOPERATION AND EQUITY-BASED PLANNING AND DECISION-MAKING AMONG UTA SALT LAKE CITY AND THE UNIVERSITY OF UTAH. THE STUDY WILL DETERMINE ALIGNMENT AND MODE TO CONNECT THE UNIVERSITY OF UTAH RESEARCH PARK AREA THE GRANARY DISTRICT AND THE DEPOT DISTRICT AND WILL ALSO ADDRESS INEQUITY AND CLIMATE CHANGE IN THE CORRIDOR. COORDINATION WITH SALT LAKE CITYS REDEVELOPMENT AGENCY AND OTHER SALT LAKE CITY DEPARTMENTS TO ENSURE THAT LAND USE AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING IS CONSIDERED AND PROMOTED IN THE STUDY WILL BE PARAMOUNT. FINALLY THE STUDY WILL INTRODUCE UNIVERSITY OF UTAH STUDENTS TO THE TRANSPORTATION CORRIDOR PLANNING PROCESS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS A TRANSIT STUDY THAT WILL DRIVE THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE TECHLINK CORRIDOR FOR CONNECTIONS EQUITY AND DEVELOPMENT.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: CITIZENS AND VISITORS TO SALT LAKE CITY ESPECIALLY THE RESIDENTS OF THE GRANARY AND THE DEPOT AREA AND THE STUDENTS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF UTAH.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FY2020 BUILD FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE NORTH CENTRAL TEXAS COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS IN THE AMOUNT OF $25000000. THE PROJECT WAS SELECTED BY THE US DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION UNDER THE BUILD PROGRAM. THE PROJECT GRANT AGREEMENT (PGA) AS AMENDED WITH COMMENTS FROM FTA HQ IS ATTACHED IN THE DOCUMENTS SECTION- UPLOADED ON 8/23/22. PURPOSE: THE NORTH TEXAS MULTIMODAL OPERATIONS VELOCITY EFFICIENCY AND SAFETY PROGRAM (NT MOVES) IS A LONGRANGE PLAN FOR INCREASING FREIGHT AND PASSENGER MOBILITY IN DALLASFORT WORTH (DFW) THROUGH STRATEGIC INVESTMENT IN RAIL CAPACITY TO IMPROVE MULTIMODAL TRANSPORTATION. NT MOVES IS A PROGRAM OF ROAD AND RAILWAY IMPROVEMENTS IN THE NORTH CENTRAL TEXAS REGION INTENDED TO ENHANCE FREIGHT AND PASSENGER MOBILITY ACROSS ALL MODES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE FOLLOWING HIGHLIGHTS THREE COMPONENTS OF THE NT MOVES PROJECT IN A COMMUTER AND FREIGHT RAIL CORRIDOR CONNECTING DALLAS AND FORT WORTH IN NORTH CENTRAL TEXAS. THE PROJECTS COMPONENTS INCLUDE:COMPONENT 1: DOUBLE TRACK MEDICAL MARKET CENTER TO STEMMONS FREEWAYCOMPONENT 2: DOUBLE TRACK HANDLEY EDERVILLE ROAD TO PRECINCT LINE ROADCOMPONENT 3: IMPLEMENT CLEAR PATH TECHNOLOGYEXPECTED OUTCOMES: THESE PROJECTS WILL PROVIDE IMPROVED SAFETY IMPROVED CAPACITY INCREASED RAIL TRAFFIC SPEEDS SHARED-USE CORRIDORS AND INTERCONNECTED NETWORK ISSUES MONITOR ONGOING PERFORMANCE MEASURES IMPROVED CAPITAL PROJECT SELECTION AND FACILITATED PUBLIC-PRIVATE PARTNERSHIPS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES ARE TRE DART AMTRAK AND TRINITY METRO. THIS WILL ALSO HELP ALL FREIGHT RAILROADS THAT OPERATE ON THE CORRIDOR AND RAILROADS PARTICIPATING IN THE CLEAR PATH PROGRAM. THIS WILL ALSO HELP WITH MODE SHIFT AS IT ADDS CAPACITY TO REGIONAL RAILROADS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE SUBRECIPIENTS WILL BE DART AND TRINITY SINCE THEY MAINTAIN THE TRE RAIL CORRIDOR. THEIR WORK WILL INCLUDE THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE TWO DOUBLE TRACK AND BRIDGE PROJECTS. THESE PROJECTS HAVE BEEN INCLUDED IN THE 2021-2024 TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (TIP) APPROVED BY THE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION COUNCIL ON MAY 14TH 2020. (TIP DOCUMENT 1.PDF AND TIP DOCUMENT 2.PDF). THE FY2022-2023 UPWP IS ALSO ATTACHED (FY22-FY23-UPWP_PG.161-162.PDF). THESE DOCUMENTS CAN BE FOUND UNDER APPLICATION DOCUMENTS.

CLOSE OUT AMENDMENTTHE SCOPE OF WORK DESCRIBED IN THIS AWARD WAS COMPLETED. THE PAPER GRANT AGREEMENT (PGA) AMENDMENT HAS A PLANNED PROJECT COMPLETION DATE OF MAY 21 2021. ACTUAL PROJECT COMPLETION DATE WAS APRIL 23 2021. THE PGA AMENDMENT HAS PLANNED PROJECT CLOSEOUT DATE OF JUNE 11 2021. ACTUAL PROJECT CLOSEOUT WAS IN AUGUST 2021.BECAUSE THE PROJECT WAS COMPLETED IN SPRING OF 2021 ANNUAL INTERIM PERFORMANCE MEASURE REPORTS WILL START BEING SUBMITTED NO LATER THAN AUGUST 15 2021 AND CONTINUE ANNUALLY FOR 5 YEARS.THE COSTS OF THE PROJECT WERE ALMOST 9% HIGHER THAN INITIALLY PLANNED WITH THE ORIGINAL GRANT APPLICATION. NASHVILLE SECURED ADDITIONAL LOCAL FUNDING FOR PARTS OF THE PROJECT AND A REGIONAL CONGESTION MITIGATION AIR QUALITY (CMAQ) AWARD TO ADVANCE TRANSIT SIGNAL PRIORITY IN NASHVILLE. THE ADDITIONAL FUNDING IS REFERENCED IN THE PGA AMENDMENT. THE CMAQ FUNDING IS IN FEDERAL AWARD IDENTIFICATION NUMBER (FAIN) TN-2017-055-00 IN TRAMS. TOTAL PROJECT COSTS WERE $15544771. THE COSTS WERE FUNDED USING THE $10000000 TIGER V IN THIS AWARD THE INITIAL LOCAL MATCH OF $3790967 ADDITIONAL LOCAL MATCH OF $1221704 WHICH HAS BEEN ADDED WITH THIS CLOSE OUT AMENDMENT AND $532100 ($425679 FEDERAL $106421 LOCAL) FROM TN-2017-055-00. THESE FUNDING AMOUNTS ARE REFERENCED IN THE PGA AMENDMENT.******************************AMENDMENT EFFECTIVE 09/04/19*******************************************************************************************************************THIS PROJECT IS BEING AMENDED TO REFLECT CHANGES TO THE SCOPE BUDGET AND TIMELINE THAT WERE CHANGED WITH PAPER GRANT AGREEMENT AMENDMENT 0001. THE PAPER AMENDMENT CONTAINING MORE DETAILS HAS BEEN ATTACHED TO THIS AWARD RECORD.THE BUDGET/TIMELINE FOR THE PROJECT WAS ADJUSTED AND HAS BEEN ADJUSTED IN THE ALI MILESTONES AND THE SCOPE WAS MODIFIED. THE ORIGINAL TIGER V GRANT SCOPE CONTAINS SPECIFIC LANGUAGE STATING PEDESTRIAN CROSSINGS AT ALL SIGNALIZED INTERSECTIONS DESIGNED TO MINIMIZE CROSSING TIMES AND INCREASE SAFETY FOR PEDESTRIANS. AS WE PROCEEDED WITH THE DESIGN OF IMPROVEMENTS FOR ALL INTERSECTIONS ON THE MURFREESBORO ROAD CORRIDOR THE PROJECT TEAM DETERMINED THAT 2 INTERSECTIONS MERIT CONSIDERATION FOR BEING EXCEPTIONS TO THIS PORTION OF THE GRANT SCOPE REQUIREMENT. WE HAVE REQUESTED THAT THE PORTION OF THE SCOPE NOTED ABOVE BE WAIVED FOR THE FOLLOWING LOCATIONS:1.BRILEY PARKWAY INTERCHANGE WITH MURFREESBORO ROAD- THIS LOCATION IS A GRADE SEPARATED INTERCHANGE WITH BRILEY PARKWAY BEING THE OVERHEAD ROUTE. THE INTERSECTION BENEATH THE STRUCTURE IS SIGNALIZED BUT THERE ARE NO PROVISIONS WITHIN THE LIMITS OF THE INTERCHANGE CONFIGURATION FOR PEDESTRIANS. BUS STOPS ARE LOCATED AT EACH INTERSECTION ADJACENT TO THE INTERCHANGE WHERE SIDEWALKS END. THERE SHOULD BE NO REASON FOR PEDESTRIANS TO CROSS BENEATH THIS INTERCHANGE TO ACCESS A BUS STOP.2.SMITH SPRINGS ROAD INTERSECTION WITH MURFREESBORO ROAD- THIS INTERSECTION CURRENTLY HAS SIDEWALK INFRASTRUCTURE IN ONE QUADRANT ONLY. THE OTHER 3- QUADRANTS CURRENTLY HAVE GUARDRAIL IMMEDIATELY BEHIND THE ROADWAY SHOULDER AND CONTAIN NO ROOM FOR SIDEWALKS. THESE SAME 3- QUADRANTS HAVE VERY STEEP DROP-OFFS BEHIND THE GUARDRAIL MAKING FUTURE SIDEWALK CONSTRUCTION COST PROHIBITIVE AND UNLIKELY. CONSTRUCTION OF CROSSINGS HERE APPEAR TO BE WITHOUT PURPOSE AND UNNECESSARILY COSTLY.NEITHER OF THESE INTERSECTIONS IS SERVICED BY HIGH FREQUENCY FEWER STOP TRANSIT SERVICE ALONG THE CORRIDOR AND THE LOCAL BUS SERVICE HAS VERY LOW BOARDINGS AND ALIGHTINGS NEAR THESE LOCATIONS. PICTURES OF BOTH INTERSECTIONS ARE ENCLOSED WITH THIS REQUEST.THE REVISED SCOPE IS AS FOLLOWS:THE PROJECT IS COMPOSED OF SEVERAL MODAL COMPONENTS: INTERSECTION SIGNALIZATION SIDEWALK AND CROSSWALK IMPROVEMENTS; AND BUS SIGNAL PRIORITY SOFTWARE EQUIPMENT AND PASSENGER AMENITIES.THE NASHVILLE MTA AND NASHVILLE METRO PUBLIC WORKS ARE CHANGING THE ROADWAY AND SIGNAL NETWORK BY EMPHASIZING THE ACCOMMODATION OF PEDESTRIANS AND TRANSIT USERS. THIS PROJECT INCLUDES THE INSTALLATION OF BUS PRIORITY EQUIPMENT ON ALL FIXED ROUTE BUSES AND AT ALL SIGNALIZED INTERSECTIONS ON THE MURFREESBORO ROAD CORRIDOR IN NASHVILLE. THIS PROJECT ALSO INCLUDES FUNDS FOR UPGRADED PASSENGER AMENITIES THROUGHOUT THE MTA SERVICE AREA INCLUDING UPGRADED BUS SHELTERS AND REAL TIME INFORMATION SIGNS ALONG HIGH RIDERSHIP BUS ROUTES AND THE FREE MUSIC CITY CIRCUIT ROUTES.PROVIDING BUS PRIORITY EQUIPMENT ON ALL FIXED ROUTE BUSES WILL ALLOW THE GREATEST FLEXIBILITY IN ASSIGNING BUSES TO THESE ROUTES THUS ASSURING THAT THE BUSES OPERATING ON THESE ROUTES HAVE THE FEATURES NECESSARY TO BEST SERVE THE RIDERS. IN ADDITION NEW TRAFFIC SIGNAL CONTROLLERS WITH ROBUST BUS PRIORITY FEATURES WILL REPLACE EXISTING 30 YEAR OLD TECHNOLOGY CURRENTLY UTILIZED AT THE INTERSECTIONS. HAVING BUS PRIORITY EQUIPMENT ON ALL FIXED ROUTE VEHICLES WILL ALLOW THE EXPANSION OF THIS SYSTEM TO OTHER BUS ROUTES AS TRAFFIC SIGNAL CONTROLLERS ON THESE ROUTES ARE UPDATED.THIS PROJECT INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING COMPONENTS:BUS PRIORITY AT EVERY SIGNAL OUTSIDE THE CBD ON THE MURFREESBORO ROAD TRANSIT ROUTES TO IMPROVE ON TIME PERFORMANCE AND REDUCED TRAVEL TIMES. CONTROL SYSTEM SOFTWARE AND SIGNAL CONTROLLER SELECTION WILL BE PRIMARILY BASED ON THE ABILITY TO IMPROVE RESPONSIVENESS OF THE BUS PRIORITY SYSTEM.NEW CONTROLLERS AND CENTRAL SOFTWARE TO MONITOR SIGNAL PERFORMANCE TO ASSURE THAT BUS PRIORITY IS WORKING AND THAT THE TRAFFIC SIGNALS ARE FULLY OPERATIONAL.NEW SIGNAL EQUIPMENT TO INCREASE EFFICIENCY AND TO BE IN FULL COMPLIANCE WITH MUTCD AND ADA. THIS INCLUDES STANDARD PLACEMENT OF SIGNAL AND PEDESTRIAN INDICATIONS 12 LED VEHICULAR INDICATIONS LED PEDESTRIAN COUNTDOWN INDICATIONS PAD MOUNTED CONTROL CABINETS ETC.REPLACEMENT OF NON-SUPPORTED TRAFFIC SIGNAL CONTROLLERS AND SIGNAL EQUIPMENT THAT HAS EXCEEDED ITS SERVICE LIFE WILL IMPROVE RELIABILITY AND DECREASE SERVICE CALLS AND CONGESTION RELATED TO EQUIPMENT FAILURES.NEW CENTRAL SOFTWARE WILL ALLOW EXPANSION OF BUS PRIORITY MONITORING TO ALL BUS ROUTES IN THE FUTURE.PEDESTRIAN CROSSINGS AT ALL BUT TWO OF THE SIGNALIZED INTERSECTIONS DESIGNED TO MINIMIZE CROSSING TIMES AND INCREASE SAFETY FOR PEDESTRIANS. THE BRILEY PARKWAY INTERCHANGE WITH MURFREESBORO ROAD AND THE SMITH SPRINGS ROAD INTERSECTION WITH MURFREESBORO ROAD WILL NOT INCLUDE PEDESTRIAN CROSSING IMPROVEMENTS.UPGRADED PASSENGER AMENITIES THROUGHOUT THE MTA SERVICE AREA INCLUDING NEW BUS SHELTERS AND SIGNS WITH REAL TIME BUS ARRIVAL INFORMATION.SIDEWALKS LINKING THE BUS STOPS TO THE SIGNALIZED INTERSECTIONS TO FACILITATE ACCESS TO TRANSIT ALONG MURFREESBORO ROAD.COUNTDOWN PEDESTRIAN INDICATIONS AND UPDATED SIGNAL TIMING WILL ACCOMMODATE PEDESTRIANS TRAVELING TO AND FROM THE TRANSIT STOPS AND COMPLY WITH THE REVISED PEDESTRIAN SIGNAL TIMING POLICES IN THE MUTCD.ADA RAMPS AND LANDINGS AT ALL BUT TWO OF THE SIGNALIZED CROSSINGS TO PROVIDE A SAFE PLACE FOR PEDESTRIANS TO WAIT FOR A WALK SIGNAL OUTSIDE THE ROADWAY. THE BRILEY PARKWAY INTERCHANGE WITH MURFREESBORO ROAD AND THE SMITH SPRINGS ROAD INTERSECTION WITH MURFREESBORO ROAD WILL NOT INCLUDE PEDESTRIAN CROSSING IMPROVEMENTS.************************************************ORIGINAL APPLICATIONTHE PROJECT IS COMPOSED OF SEVERAL MODAL COMPONENTS INCLUDING; INTERSECTION SIGNALIZATION SIDEWALK AND CROSSWALK IMPROVEMENTS; AND BUS SIGNAL PRIORITY SOFTWARE EQUIPMENT AND PASSENGER AMENITIES. THE MEMPHIS AREA TRANSIT AUTHORITY (MATA) IS FILING THIS GRANT APPLICATION WITH THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) TO REQUEST $17800000 AWARDED IN AN AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (THE USDOT) AND MATA (THE RECIPIENT). THE APPLICATION FOR FUNDING WAS DATED JULY 15 2019 AND TITLED MEMPHIS INNOVATION CORRIDOR. IT CONTAINED STANDARD FORM 424 AND ALL INFORMATION AND ATTACHMENTS SUBMITTED WITH THAT FORM THROUGH GRANTS.GOV. THE USDOT GRANT AGREEMENT REFLECTS THE SELECTION OF THE RECIPIENT FOR AN AWARD UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THE CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT 2019 (PUB. L. 116-6 FEBRUARY 15 2019) REGARDING NATIONAL INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENTS AS DESCRIBED IN THE NOTICE OF FUNDING OPPORTUNITY FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATIONS NATIONAL INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENTS UNDER THE CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT 2019 84 FR 16933 (APRIL 23 2019) (THE NOFO). IN THIS AGREEMENT FY BUILD TRANSPORTATION DISCRETIONARY GRANT MEANS AN AWARD UNDER THOSE PROVISIONS. THE USDOT GRANT AGREEMENT WHICH IS ATTACHED IN THE DOCUMENTS SECTION OF THIS GRANT APPLICATION. THE ORIGINAL SF-424 SUBMITTED WITH THE BUILD GRANT APPLICATION AND THE BUILD FACT SHEET FROM FHWAS WEBSITE ARE ATTACHED IN THE DOCUMENTS SECTION. MATA WILL FOLLOW ALL THIRD-PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C 4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE) AND WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.ON THE SF-424 FORM MATA LISTED CONGRESSIONAL DISTRICTS: THE BUILD PROJECT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED IN DISTRICT 09.THE MEMPHIS INNOVATION CORRIDOR PROJECT IS AN EIGHT-MILE SEGMENT OF A MULTIMODAL CORRIDOR THAT CONNECTS DOWNTOWN MEMPHIS TO THE UNIVERSITY OF MEMPHIS. THE MEMPHIS INNOVATION CORRIDOR IS COMPRISED OF TWO PROJECTS. THE OVERALL PROJECT WAS DESCRIBED IN THE ORIGINAL BUILD GRANT APPLICATION. THE FIRST PROJECT WILL BE THE BUILD GRANT FUNDED PROJECT THAT WILL HAVE INDEPENDENT UTILITY WHILE RETAINING THE ABILITY TO IMPLEMENT ADDITIONAL PROJECTS IN THE CORRIDOR AS FUNDING BECOMES AVAILABLE. THE SCOPE OF THE BUILD GRANT PROJECT WILL CONSIST OF THE PURCHASE OF 14 BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES THE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF ELECTRIC VEHICLE CHARGING EQUIPMENT THE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF TICKET VENDING MACHINES AND THE PURCHASE AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE AUTOMATED TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT SYSTEM. THESE ELEMENTS WILL ALLOW MATA TO IMPLEMENT SERVICE CHANGES ALONG AN EXISTING ACTIVE BUS ROUTE INCREASE THE FREQUENCY OF SERVICE ALONG THIS CORRIDOR AND IMPLEMENT TRANSIT SIGNAL PRIORITY IN ORDER TO IMPROVE FREQUENCY RELIABILITY AND TRAVEL TIMES. THE COSTS AND ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN THIS APPLICATION ONLY PERTAIN TO THE ELEMENTS DESCRIBED ABOVE. KCATA IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE PROVISION OF FIXED-ROUTE BUS RAPID TRANSIT (BRT) FLEX-ROUTE AND COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN THE REGION. THE KCSA IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION FORMED FOR THE PURPOSE OF MANAGING OPERATING AND MAINTAINING THE STREETCAR AS WELL AS PLANNING FOR FUTURE STREETCAR EXTENSIONS. IN ADDITION TO OVERSEEING STREETCAR OPERATIONS THE KCSA SUPPORTS SYSTEM BRANDING MARKETING PUBLIC COMMUNICATION AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT. WHILE THE KCSA IS A SEPARATE ENTITY IT WORKS CLOSELY WITH THE CITY OF KANSAS CITY MISSOURI AND THE KCATA. THE DAY-TO-DAY FUNCTIONS OF THE KCSA ARE MANAGED BY ITS STAFF OF FOUR WITH OVERSIGHT FROM THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. PORT KC IS ANOTHER STAKEHOLDER IN THE GRANT APPLICATION. PORT KC IS AN INDEPENDENT GOVERNMENTAL AGENCY BUT THEY COLLABORATE AND SHARE THE GOALS OF KANSAS CITY AND THE STATE OF MISSOURI. THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FY 2019 BUILD FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE CITY-PARISH OF BATON ROUGE LOUISIANA IN THE AMOUNT OF $15000000. THE PROJECT WAS SELECTED BY THE US DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION UNDER THE BUILD PROGRAM.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS BUILD GRANT AWARD IS TO ASSIST WITH CONSTRUCTING THE PLANK-NICHOLSON BUS RAPID TRANSIT PROJECT FOR THE CITY-PARISH OF BATON ROUGE TO BE OPERATED BY CATS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER THE CONSTRUCTION OF BRT STATIONS AND RELATED IMPROVEMENTS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT THE CITY-PARISH OF BATON ROUGE TO COMPLETE THE PLANK-NICHOLSON BUS RAPID TRANSIT PROJECT CORRIDOR.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: POPULATION WITHIN THE CATS TRANSIT SERVICE AREA AND LOCAL AREA COMMUTERS. SUBRECIPIENTS: NONETHE PLANK-NICHOLSON BUS RAPID TRANSIT (BRT) PROJECT WILL DESIGN BUILD AND IMPLEMENT A BRT ROUTE CONNECTING NORTH BATON ROUGE TO THE LOUISIANA STATE UNIVERSITY THROUGH DOWNTOWN BATON ROUGES CENTRAL BUSINESS DISTRICT. THE ROUTES NORTHERN TERMINUS IS THE PLANNED NORTH TRANSFER CENTER (FUNDED THROUGH THE PROJECT) AND THE ROUTE WILL UTILIZE AIRLINE HIGHWAY WEST TO PLANK ROAD AND TRANSITION TO 22ND STREET SOUTH TO FLORIDA STREET. THE ROUTE PROCEEDS WEST ALONG FLORIDA STREET TO 4TH STREET IN DOWNTOWN BATON ROUGE THEN TURNS SOUTH. RUNNING ALONG 4TH STREET THE BRT SERVICE WILL TRANSITION ONE BLOCK WEST AT SOUTH BOULEVARD AND THEN CONTINUE SOUTH ON NICHOLSON DRIVE. THE ROUTE WILL CONTINUE TO THE LSU CAMPUS AND TERMINATE WITH A LAYOVER AREA NEAR SKIP BERTMAN DRIVE. THE APPROXIMATE NINE-MILE BRT CORRIDOR WILL FEATURE 22 PAIRS OF STATIONS WITH REAL-TIME INFORMATION AND LEVEL BOARDING UNIQUE BRANDED VEHICLES AND OTHER ENHANCEMENTS DESIGNED TO MAKE THE LINE ATTRACTIVE TO EXISTING RIDERS AND PROSPECTIVE RIDER INCLUDING A NEW TRANSFER CENTER AT THE NORTHERN TERMINUS. ADDITIONAL CORRIDOR INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS WILL ENHANCE CONNECTIVITY TO STATIONS IMPROVE PEDESTRIAN SAFETY STREAMLINE TRAFFIC AND TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND ADD TO THE OVERALL EFFECTIVENESS OF PLANK-NICHOLSON BRT. LOCAL FUNDING FOR THE PROJECT IS PROVIDED THROUGH CITY-PARISH OF BATON ROUGE MOVEBR PROGRAM FUNDS AS WELL AS CATS LOCAL CONTRIBUTIONS FORMALIZED THROUGH COOPERATIVE ENDEAVOUR AGREEMENT (CEA). THESE AGREEMENTS ARE ATTACHED TO THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS.FUNDING FOR THE $34267500M PROJECT WILL COME FROM A VARIETY OF SOURCES. A COMPLETE PROJECT CAPITAL FUNDING MATRIX IS LOCATED IN THE PROJECT DOCUMENTS SECTION. THE BUILD GRANT FUNDING WILL COVER THE COST OF CONSTRUCTING THE BRT STATIONS IN THE CORRIDOR. OTHER PROJECT IMPROVEMENTS NOT INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT WILL BE FUNDED THROUGH LOCAL FUNDING FROM THE CITY-PARISH MOVEBR PROGRAM AND OTHER SOURCES INCLUDING LADOTD ROAD TRANSFER FUNDS FHWA FUNDS SURFACE TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM FUNDS AND FTA FORMULA 5307 AND 5339 PROGRAM FUNDS. THESE IMPROVEMENTS INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING WORK AS WELL AS PROJECT CONTINGENCY:NORTH TRANSFER CENTER WITH MULTIPLE BUS BAYS FOR BRT AND CONNECTING ROUTES PASSENGER WAITING SEATING OVERHEAD CANOPIES A DRIVER RELIEF BUILDING WITH RESTROOMS A BREAK AREA AND SECURITY OFFICE AND APPROXIMATELY 25 PARKING SPACES TO SERVE PARK AND RIDE DEMAND. CONSTRUCTION OF ROADWAY IMPROVEMENTS INCLUDING CONCRETE BUS PADS STRIPING AND CURB REPLACEMENT AT STATIONS.CONSTRUCTION OF INTERSECTION IMPROVEMENTS INCLUDING SIGNAL UPGRADES WITH TRANSIT SIGNAL PRIORITY CROSSWALKS AND ADA IMPROVEMENTS.SIDEWALK CONSTRUCTION/REPLACEMENT ALONG PLANK ROAD 22ND STREET AND FLORIDA STREET.PURCHASE OF UP TO 4 ELECTRIC BRT BUSES WITH BRANDING CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE AND SPARE PARTS. ALSO INCLUDED IS 1 NON-REVENUE MAINTENANCE VEHICLE.

MIAMI-DADE COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION AND PUBLIC WORKS (DTPW) IS FILING THIS GRANT APPLICATION WITH THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) TO REQUEST $22360552 AWARDED IN AN AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (THE USDOT) AND MIAMI-DADE COUNTY (THE RECIPIENT). THE APPLICATION FOR FUNDING WAS DATED JULY 12 2019 AND TITLED FY 2019 BETTER UTILIZING INVESTMENT TO LEVERAGE DEVELOPMENT (BUILD) TRANSPORTATION GRANTS FOR THE UNDERLINE MULTIMODAL MOBILITY CORRIDOR. IT CONTAINED STANDARD FORM 424 AND ALL INFORMATION AND ATTACHMENTS SUBMITTED WITH THAT FORM THROUGH GRANTS.GOV. THE USDOT GRANT AGREEMENT REFLECTS THE SELECTION OF THE RECIPIENT FOR AN AWARD UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THE CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT 2019 (PUB. L. 116-6 FEBRUARY 15 2019) REGARDING NATIONAL INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENTS AS DESCRIBED IN THE NOTICE OF FUNDING OPPORTUNITY FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATIONS NATIONAL INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENTS UNDER THE CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT 2019 84 FR 16933 (APRIL 23 2019) (THE NOFO). IN THIS AGREEMENT FY BUILD TRANSPORTATION DISCRETIONARY GRANT MEANS AN AWARD UNDER THOSE PROVISIONS. THE USDOT GRANT AGREEMENT WAS FULLY EXECUTED ON SEPTEMBER 27 2021 WHICH IS ATTACHED IN THE DOCUMENTS SECTION OF THIS GRANT APPLICATION. THE ORIGINAL SF-424 SUBMITTED WITH THE BUILD GRANT APPLICATION AND THE BUILD FACT SHEET FROM FHWAS WEBSITE ARE ATTACHED IN THE DOCUMENTS SECTION. DTPW WILL FOLLOW ALL THIRD-PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C 4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE) AND WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.DTPW INITIALLY CREATED THE GRANT TEMPLATE DURING FISCAL YEAR 2021 UNDER 1089-2021-2 WHICH REFERENCES THE PGA AND LATER DELETED IT AND RE-CREATED A NEWER FAIN # 1089-2022-3 WHICH REFERENCES THE MOST RECENT TRAMS GRANT APPLICATION TEMPLATE. ON THE SF-424 FORM DTPW LISTED TWO (2) CONGRESSIONAL DISTRICTS FL-24 AND FL-27 AND HAVE SINCE REMOVED DISTRICT FL-24. THE APPLICANT IS LOCATED WITHIN DISTRICT FL-24 BUT THE UNDERLINE BUILD PROJECT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED IN DISTRICT FL-27.PURPOSE-THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT THE UNDERLINE MULTIMODAL MOBILITY CORRIDOR FROM SW 19TH AVENUE TO THE DADELAND METRORAIL STATION. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED- FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ALL ARCHITECTURAL AND ENGINEERING/DESIGN FEES INSPECTION COSTS AND DEMOLITION AND DEBRIS REMOVAL AND THE CONSTRUCTION FOR THE UNDERLINE MULTIMODAL MOBILITY CORRIDOR. EXPECTED OUTCOMES- EXPECTED OUTCOMES FOR THIS FUNDING WILL BE TO PROVIDE THE RIDING AND WALKING PUBLIC ENHANCEMENTS TO OUR SYSTEM AND TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL MOBILITY OPTIONS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES- TO IMPROVE CONNECTIVITY AND SAFETY FOR TRANSIT PATRONS IN ONE OF THE DENSEST AREAS OF THE SEVENTH-MOST POPULATED COUNTY IN THE NATION. WITH THE IMPROVEMENT OF THIRTY-SIX INTERSECTION CROSSINGS ADDITION OF LIGHTING SEPARATION FROM U.S.1 AND REMEDIATION OF EXISTING CONTAMINATION USER SAFETY CONDITIONS WILL BE GREATLY ENHANCED. THE PUBLIC/PRIVATE PROJECT WILL GENERATE A SUBSTANTIAL RETURN ON INVESTMENT INCLUDING INCREASED PROPERTY VALUES NEW HOUSING JOB CREATION AND ADDITIONAL COMMERCE AND RETAIL ADJACENT TO TRANSIT FACILITIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES- THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION.THE UNDERLINE PROJECT IS A 10-MILE SEGMENT OF A MULTIMODAL CORRIDOR THAT CONNECTS TO 8 METRORAIL STATIONS TO BE COMPLETED IN THREE PHASES. THE FIRST TWO PHASES WERE INCLUDED IN THE ORIGINAL PGA APPLICATION BUT IS NOT INCLUDED IN THE BUILD TRAMS APPLICATION WHICH IS ATTACHED. THE 2.3-MILE SEGMENT OF THE CORRIDOR CONNECTING TO TWO STATIONS WERE FUNDED LOCALLY AND WAS UNDER CONSTRUCTION AT THE TIME OF THE APPLICATION. PHASE 1 IS COMPLETE AND PHASE 2 IS IN PROGRESS. ACTIVITIES FOR PHASES 1 AND 2 WERE NOT INTENDED TO BE PART OF THE BUILD PROJECT AND WILL NOT BE REIMBURSED BY THIS BUILD GRANT. THE THIRD PHASE OF THE PROJECT A 7.3-MILE SEGMENT CONNECTING 6 STATIONS WILL BE FUNDED WITH BUILD FUNDS. THIS PROJECT SCOPE INCLUDES THE DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF MULTIMODAL ENHANCEMENTS INTEGRATED WITH MASS TRANSIT INCLUDING PEDESTRIAN AND BICYCLE PATHS ROADWAY INTERSECTION IMPROVEMENTS A NEW BRIDGE OVER CORAL GABLES WATERWAY LIGHTING PAVEMENT SIGNAGE AND ENVIRONMENTAL REMEDIATION. THE COSTS AND ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN THIS APPLICATION ONLY PERTAINS TO PHASE 3 OF THE UNDERLINE BUILD PROJECT.THE ESTIMATED COST FOR THE UNDERLINE PHASE 3 (BUILD PROJECT) TRANSPORTATION COMPONENT IS $100951325 AND THE ELIGIBLE PROJECT COST IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE EXECUTED PGA. THE APPROVED BUILD GRANT FUNDING FOR THIS PROJECT IS $22360552.00 AND THE LOCAL SHARE IS $77090773. THE COSTS AND ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN THIS APPLICATION ONLY PERTAINS TO PHASE 3 OF THE UNDERLINE BUILD PROJECT AND THE STIP FM#: IS 435501-5. THE REMAINING PROJECT COSTS WILL BE PROVIDED USING FY 2019 STATE APPROPRIATION FUNDING THROUGH THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION MIAMI-DADE COUNTY ROAD IMPACT FEES DEVELOPER AND MUNICIPAL FUNDING. THE STATE FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1500000 IS INCLUDED IN THE CONSTRUCTION ALI LINE ITEM AND THE STIP FM#: IS 445793-1 AND THIS FUNDING IS A PART OF NONFEDERAL FUNDS.THE FEDERAL SHARE OF PROJECT COSTS FOR WHICH AN EXPENDITURE IS MADE UNDER THE BUILD GRANT PROGRAM MAY NOT EXCEED 80 PERCENT. THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST $400000 IN BUILD FUNDS AS COMPETITIVELY AWARDED TO THE WESTERN CONNECTICUT COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (WESTCOG). HARTRANSIT AS AN FTA GRANTEE WILL ADMINISTER THE PROJECT AND WESTCOG WILL CARRY IT OUT AS A SUBRECIPIENT.PURPOSE: TO FUND A STUDY OF THE METRO NORTH RAILROAD (MNR) DANBURY AND NEW CANAAN BRANCH LINES OF THE NEW HAVEN LINE. THE PURPOSE IS TO ASSESS THE FEASIBILITY OF APPLYING VALUE CAPTURE MECHANISMS TOWARD FINANCING IDENTIFIED CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS ON THE BRANCH LINES - AND ULTIMATELY LEAD TO THE FULL ELECTRIFICATION OF THE DANBURY BRANCH. WESTCOG WILL PROVIDE THE LOCAL MATCH OF $100000ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE CONSULTANT TEAM WILL PRODUCE A FEASIBILITY STUDY WITH THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES: - DETERMINE WHETHER REGIONAL VALUE CAPTURE MECHANISMS (OR COMPARABLE MECHANISMS) ARE A VIABLE FUNDING SOURCE SUPPORTING NEEDED IMPROVEMENTS ON THE DANBURY AND NEW CANAAN BRANCH LINES;- EVALUATE ALTERNATE FUNDING MECHANISMS IF REGIONAL VALUE CAPTURE MECHANISMS ARE DETERMINED NOT TO BE VIABLE (OR ALTERNATE MECHANISMS ARE MORE EFFECTIVE); AND - CREATE A REALISTIC STEP-BY-STEP PLAN TO IMPLEMENT STUDY RECOMMENDATIONS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IF FOUND FAVORABLE VALUE CAPTURE TECHNIQUES WILL BE APPLIED TOWARD THE DEVELOPMENT OF A FINANCIAL PLAN FOR MAKING THE NECESSARY BRANCH UPGRADES. THESE UPGRADES ARE PROPOSED TO IMPROVE STATE OF GOOD REPAIR (SGR) ON THE BRANCH LINES WHILE REDUCING TRIP TIMES THUS IMPROVING PASSENGER RAIL SERVICE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: DIRECT BENEFICIARIES WILL INCLUDE MNR DANBURY AND NEW CANAAN BRANCH PASSENGERS AS WELL AS OTHER RAILROADS THAT MAY HAVE OPERATING RIGHTS. INDIRECT BENEFICIARIES WILL INCLUDE THE BRANCHS HOST COMMUNITIES AND THE 18-MUNICIPALITY WESTCOG REGION AS A WHOLE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE SUBRECIPIENT (WESTCOG) WILL CONDUCT A CONSULTANT PROCUREMENT PROCESS ENGAGE THE SERVICES OF A CONSULTANT TEAM AND OVERSEE THE CONSULTANTS WORK ON THE FEASIBILITY STUDY. INCLUDED IN THESE ACTIVITIES ARE A PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT PROCESS TO BE IMPLEMENTED THROUGHOUT THE STUDY.THIS PROJECT IS LISTED IN THE ACTIVE CONNECTICUT STIP. PROJECT START DATE: 7/15/2022PROJECT END DATE: 1/31/2025

AWARD PURPOSETHIS PLANNING PROJECT WILL STUDY POTENTIAL NAVIGATIONAL IMPROVEMENTS IN THE SAIPAN HARBOR FOR TWO POTENTIAL FUTURE PROJECTS 1 EXTEND CHARLIE 1 DOCK AND 2 DREDGE THE ENTRANCE CHANNEL TURNING BASIN NORTH AND SOUTH SEAPLANE RAMPS AND ECHO DOCK AREAS TO ALLOW LARGER VESSELS TO DOCK AT THE PORT INCLUDING CRUISE SHIPS AND UPDATED LIQUID BULK VESSELS.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED THE RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT PLANNING FOR TWO PORT OF SAIPAN PROJECTS WITH TWO SEPARATE ARCHITECTURAL AND ENGINEERING A AND E DESIGN CONSULTANTS. THIS STATEMENT OF WORK IS COMPRISED OF THE FOLLOWING COMPONENTS EXTENDING CHARLIE 1 DOCK DREDGING THE ENTRANCE CHANNEL TURNING BASIN NORTH AND SOUTH SEAPLANE RAMPS AND ECHO DOCK AREAS. FOR BOTH COMPONENTS THE RECIPIENTS A AND E CONSULTANTS WILL CONDUCT THE FOLLOWING SERVICES FEASIBILITY STUDY OF ALTERNATIVES THE FEASIBILITY STUDY WHICH COULD ALSO BE REFERRED TO AS AN ALTERNATIVES ANALYSIS WILL ASSESS DIFFERENT DREDGING OPTIONS INCLUDING PREFERRED DEPTHS AND WIDTHS AND DIFFERENT PIER EXTENSION OPTIONS. THE 2021 SAIPAN HARBOR MASTER PLAN SHMP IS A SPRINGBOARD FOR THIS WORK WITH A FEW ALTERNATIVES ALREADY SUGGESTED AND SOME PRELIMINARY WORK REGARDING THE CURRENT FLOW AND SAND DEPOSITION CONDUCTED.  IN WATER BIOLOGICAL SURVEY OF THE PORT FOR BOTH THE DREDGING AND PIER EXTENSION LOCATIONS THE UNDERWATER AND ABOVE-WATER BIOLOGICAL SURVEYS OF THE DREDGING AREAS AND CHARLIE 1 PIER AND ASSOCIATED FEASIBILITY STUDIES MUST CONSIDER THE POTENTIAL FOR ENDANGERED OR THREATENED SPECIES TO BE 1 AFFECTED BY THE PROJECT AND 2 TO BE BENEFICIALLY AFFECTED THROUGH HABITAT IMPROVEMENT. ADDITIONALLY POTENTIAL IMPACTS TO ESSENTIAL FISH HABITAT DESIGNATED FOR WESTERN PACIFIC FISHERIES UNDER THE MAGNUSON STEVENS ACT MUST BE ASSESSED. PARTICULARLY IMPORTANT WILL BE THE ASSESSMENT OF THE SEAGRASS BEDS NEAR THE PROPOSED DREDGING AREAS OF THE SEAPLANE RAMPS. THIS MAY INFORM RECOMMENDATIONS FOR POTENTIAL COMPENSATORY MITIGATIONS PARTICULARLY FOR DREDGING.  PUBLIC SCOPING: CONDUCT PUBLIC SCOPING TO FULFILL NEPA REQUIREMENTS FOR EACH FUTURE CONSTRUCTION PROJECT BY ENGAGING WITH VARIOUS STAKEHOLDERS TO DISCUSS THEIR CONCERNS IDEAS AND PERSPECTIVES. WILL ENGAGE WITH LOCAL AND FEDERAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES AS REQUIRED ESPECIALLY IF OPPORTUNITIES TO PARTNER ARISE DURING THE FEASIBILITY STAGE. PERMITTING INCLUDING DRAFTING OF A BIOLOGICAL ASSESSMENT FOR ENDANGERED AND THREATENED SPECIES ON LAND AND IN THE WATER THE FEASIBILITY STUDIES FOR THE PORT OF SAIPAN WILL INFORM THE PERMITTING PROCESS. THE APPROPRIATE USACE PERMITS MUST BE ACQUIRED FOR THE DREDGING AND CHARLIE 1 DOCK EXTENSION. THE PERMITS MUST INCLUDE NEPA ENDANGERED SPECIES ACT AND OTHER ANALYSES E.G. NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT CLEAN AIR ACT CLEAN WATER ACT AND LOCAL CNMI STATUTES AND REGULATIONS. ADDITIONALLY BIOLOGICAL ASSESSMENTS MUST BE WRITTEN DURING PERMITTING TO FULFILL ESA AND MSA REQUIREMENTS TO ASSESS IMPACTS ON ENDANGERED AND THREATENED SPECIES THEIR CRITICAL HABITAT AND ESSENTIAL FISH HABITAT. THE RECIPIENT HAS DISCUSSED THE POTENTIAL PERMITTING REQUIREMENTS WITH THE USACE AND WILL BE ACTIVELY ENGAGED WITH USACE THROUGHOUT THE PERMITTING PROCESS.  DESIGN OF THE DREDGING AND CHARLIE 1 PIER EXTENSION THE HARBOR IMPROVEMENTS AND DREDGING SPECIFICS MUST BE DESIGNED BY AN ENGINEERING COMPANY. SOME PRELIMINARY DESIGNS FOR DREDGING AND PIER EXTENSION ARE INCLUDED IN THE 2021 SHMP BUT ARE NOT BASED ON A SELECTED ALTERNATIVE RATHER THEY ARE A RECOMMENDATION WITHIN THE SHMP. THE PRELIMINARY DESIGN INCLUDING NUMERIC MODELING WILL INFORM THE FEASIBILITY STUDY ALTERNATIVES ANALYSIS. FINAL DESIGN WILL BE PERFORMED ON THE RECOMMENDED ALTERNATIVE ONCE THE FEASIBILITY STUDY IS COMPLETED.  EQUITY ANALYSIS AN EQUITY ANALYSIS WILL BE CONDUCTED. THE EQUITY ANALYSIS WILL LOOK AT RACIAL AND INCOME EQUITY AND THE INHERENT BARRIERS TO OPPORTUNITY DUE TO RACE AND INCOME. COST BENEFIT ANALYSIS COST BENEFIT ANALYSES FOR THE IMPROVEMENTS WILL BE CONDUCTED. DELIVERABLES EXPECTED OUTCOMES NONE PLANNING GRANT.  INTENDED BENEFICIARY.  COMMONWEALTH PORTS AUTHORITY. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES NONE.

THE PROJECT INCLUDES A CONDITION ASSESSMENT AT EACH OF THE 60 PUBLIC WHARVES LANDING AND HARBORS IN THE REGION A NEEDS ASSESSMENT FOR THE CURRENT AND FUTURE NEEDS OF THE COMMERCIAL SEAFOODS AND MARINE INDUSTRIES AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS IDENTIFIED INFRASTRUCTURE NEEDS.
TO DEVELOP A NEW CARGO TERMINAL ON A BROWNFIELD SITE WITH PAVING LIGHTING, STORMWATER INFRASTRUCTURE, UTITLITES AND SUPPORTING INFRASTRUCTURE FOR STORAGE OF CONTAINERS AND BREAK BULK CARGO
